definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.chinese: 每年都有35万名游客走过这里。

sentences.english: The company added 16.8 million users between January and March, it said.
sentences.chinese: 消息称，一至三月中国移动新增用户有1680万名。

sentences.english: The relay will last 130 days, involving over 20,000 torchbearers.
sentences.chinese: 圣火传递将持续130天，包括2万名火炬手。

sentences.english: Millions of innocent lives are still at stake, including American lives.
sentences.chinese: 百万名无辜生命，包括美国人的生命，都冒著风险。

sentences.english: One-hundred thousand Japanese troops are now involved in rescue and relief efforts.
sentences.chinese: 十万名日本自卫队员正参与到救援减灾行动中。

sentences.english: I was the ten thousandth customer, so my dinner was on the house.
sentences.chinese: 我是第1万名顾客，所以我的晚餐免单。

sentences.english: Yamaguchi is one of about 260, 000 people who survived the attacks.
sentences.chinese: 山口勉是大约26万名幸存者之一。
普里皮亚季曾经有大约5万名居民。

sentences.english: Every week, 200,000 children under five die of disease.
sentences.chinese: 每周都有20万名五岁以下的儿童死于疾病。

sentences.english: By then, significant relief will be brought to some 40000 residents previously affected by rail noise.
sentences.chinese: 工后，4万名受铁路噪音影响的居民将会大大得益。

sentences.english: We will leave, I've read, as many as 50,000 - quote - 'advisers.'
sentences.chinese: 我看到，我们将留下多达五万名他们所说的‘顾问’。

sentences.english: Fifty-thousand U.S. troops will remain in Iraq to serve as a transitional force.
sentences.chinese: 5万名美国士兵仍会作为过渡军队留在伊拉克。

sentences.english: A radio announcer may have an audience of millions.
sentences.chinese: 一个广播员可能拥有数百万名听众。

sentences.english: There are currently about 25 million veterans still living.
sentences.chinese: 目前美国大约还有两千五百万名退伍军人健在。

sentences.english: The next 4 years will see 100,000 Americans study in China.
sentences.chinese: 预计未来4年招10万名美国学生到中国留学。

sentences.english: London shall mourn the death of twenty thousand, and the Thames will be turned into blood.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦会为二万名死者哀悼，泰晤士河会变成血色。

definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
person-times/visits/classifier for number of people participating
the hundreds place (or column) in the decimal system
the thousands place (or column) in the decimal system
over ten thousand/fig. untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
